rules.natural: Either the food delivery platform uses automated dispatch technology or it uses GPS tracking technology.

Provided that the food delivery platform violates labor laws legislation, then under the condition that non-compliance with food safety does not lead to passing inspection, it does not receive a fine.
It is either the case that the food delivery platform violates labor laws legislation or that it violates tax codes legislation.
Whenever the food delivery platform violates tax codes legislation, then assuming that failure to comply with food safety does not imply passing inspection, the platform does not receive a fine.
Either the food delivery platform expands its service or, if it operates illegally, then it gets shutdown.
Should the food delivery platform face investigation, then it does not expand its service.
In the event that the food delivery platform appeals a decision, it does not lose its license.
If the food delivery platform uses GPS tracking technology, it is profitable.

Provided that the food delivery platform violates surge pricing policy, then under the condition that the restaurant's use of the platform does not lead to the platform operating illegally, the platform does not maintain its operation.

If the food delivery platform violates delivery fees policy, then whenever the restaurant's use of the platform does not result in the platform operating illegally, the platform does not maintain its operation.
Under the condition that the food delivery platform engages in unfair practices, it either violates surge pricing policy or violates delivery fees policy.
Whenever the food delivery platform operates illegally, it does not get shutdown.
If the restaurant has a commercial kitchen facility, then the food delivery platform does not operate illegally.
Either the restaurant has a commercial kitchen facility or it has a pickup counter facility.
Should the restaurant have a pickup counter facility, then it uses the food delivery platform.
If the restaurant uses the food delivery platform, then it pays a commission to the food delivery platform.
Whenever the restaurant pays a commission to the food delivery platform, the food delivery platform does not operate illegally.
If the food delivery platform complies with food safety requirements, then it is profitable.
Should it not be the case that using automated dispatch technology implies profitability, then the food delivery platform does not violate data privacy regulation.
Provided that the restaurant's use of the platform does not lead to the platform operating illegally, the food delivery platform maintains its operation.
If it is not the case that failure of using automated dispatch technology to imply profitability leads to violating data privacy regulation, then the food delivery platform operates illegally.
Whenever it is not the case that not facing investigation implies not settling a case, the food delivery platform loses its license.
Provided that it is not true that absence of facing investigation leads to absence of settling a case, the food delivery platform appeals a decision.
In the event that non-compliance with food safety does not lead to passing inspection, the food delivery platform receives a fine.
If the food delivery platform does not face investigation, then it settles a case.
